lead_paragraph: A closely-watched survey shows German consumer confidence is on the rise, despite concerns over the recent flood of migrants and ongoing threat of terrorism.

abstract: Donald J Trump argues that United States must wage unrelenting ideological fight to defeat Islamic State during speech at Youngstown State University in Ohio, critical swing state where polls show him trailing Hillary Clinton; renews call to bar anyone from parts of world where terrorism breeds from entering US.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, in a foreign policy address, called for “extreme vetting” of prospective new arrivals that would include an “ideological test.”

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Russians protested in Moscow on Tuesday against new anti-terrorism legislation approved by President Vladimir Putin that critics say will curb basic freedoms and make it easier for the authorities to stifle dissent.
snippet: Hundreds of Russians protested in Moscow on Tuesday against new anti-terrorism legislation approved by President Vladimir Putin that critics say will curb basic freedoms and make it easier for the authorities to stifle dissent....

headline.main: Obama Addresses Arab Allies on Terrorism

abstract: Iraqi army uncovers new mass graves with every territory it reclaims from Islamic State; graves continue grim legacy of mass killings and burials begun under Saddam Hussein; militants' cruelty and body count has grown under pressure from Iraqi security force crackdown.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State has been resorting to a horrific practice that dates back to Saddam Hussein and his regime’s industrial-scale killings.

headline.main: Another Mass Grave Dug by ISIS in Iraq, and a Ghastly Ritual Renewed

abstract: France relaxes gun rule in order to permit off-duty police offers to carry their guns even if country is not in midst of state of emergency; change follows fatal stabbing of police officer and his companion by Islamic State group assailant.
lead_paragraph: The move came in response to an attack on Monday in which an Islamic State operative fatally stabbed a police officer and his companion at their home.

headline.main: France Eases Rules for Police to Carry Guns While Off Duty

byline.contributor: Milan Schreuer contributed reporting from Magnanville, France.

abstract: Comments by Donald Trump in aftermath of Orlando shooting show he is committed not only to use of fear, political tactic that has old American pedigree, but also to raising stakes by demonizing entire religious group; Trump's speech includes warning that Muslim immigrants could bring about end of country itself; Hillary Clinton, by contrast, emphasizes need for unity in speech following massacre, but both presidential candidates have been accused of exploiting tragedy to further their campaigns.
lead_paragraph: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises.
snippet: At a time when other leaders would avoid divisive language and seek unity, Mr. Trump has intensified the power of fear in presidential politics in the aftermath of national crises....

headline.print_headline: Old Political Tactic Is Revived:  Exploiting Fear, Not Easing It
headline.main: Donald Trump Responds to Orlando Attack by Exploiting Fear, Not Easing It

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: Bangladesh's police counterterrorism chief Monirul Islam reveals what his agency has discovered about killings of at least 39 people, including bloggers and religious minorities, since February 2013; murderous campaign was conceived and carried out by Islamist militant groups Ansar al-Islam and Jama’atul Mujahedeen Bangladesh in order to discredit secularism in country.
lead_paragraph: The police have implicated two militant groups in an accelerating series of attacks over the past three years and say they are preparing to round up their leaders.
snippet: The police have implicated two militant groups in an accelerating series of attacks over the past three years and say they are preparing to round up their leaders....

headline.print_headline: Bloggers, Bangladesh and Insight on 39 Killings
headline.main: Bangladesh Says It Now Knows Who’s Killing the Bloggers

byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK

abstract: European Central Bank announces it will phase out 500-euro bank note by end of 2018; move is meant to hinder cash transactions by terrorists, drug dealers and money launderers.
lead_paragraph: Though the effort has been portrayed as a blow to corruption and organized crime, some critics say it is as an infringement on personal freedom and a stealthy tool of monetary policy.
snippet: Though the effort has been portrayed as a blow to corruption and organized crime, some critics say it is as an infringement on personal freedom and a stealthy tool of monetary policy....

headline.print_headline: $1 Million in a 5-Pound Bag? Not for Long, Europe Says
headline.main: Europe to Remove 500-Euro Bill, the ‘Bin Laden’ Bank Note Criminals Love

abstract: Homeland Security officials, along with federal lawmakers, say EB-5 visa process permits wealthy foreign investors, for price that can top $1 million, to move toward United States citizenship; program is under increased scrutiny as potential national security risk as revelations of fraud and money laundering have emerged.
lead_paragraph: A Senate panel will hold a hearing on the EB-5 visa program, which allows wealthy foreign investors, for a price, to put themselves on a path to citizenship.

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A Senate panel will hold a hearing on the EB-5 visa program, which allows wealthy foreign investors, for a price, to put themselves on a path to citizenship....

headline.print_headline: Scrutiny for Visa Program That Aids Foreign Investors
